transcript.title: OFFICIAL VISIT BY NEW ZEALAND PRIME MINISTER
transcript.content:
I am delighted to announce that the Prime Minister of New Zealand, the

Right Hon Helen Clark, MP, has accepted my invitation to visit Australia

from 1 - 2 March 2000, with talks in Sydney on 2 March.

This will be Prime Minister Clark's first visit to Australia as

Prime Minister. I very much look forward to working closely with her to

further strengthen the wide-ranging partnership which Australia and New

Zealand already enjoy.

The combined efforts of Australia and New Zealand in East Timor over

recent months are but one example of that partnership in action, contributing

significantly to peace and security in our region.

We will be discussing this and other key regional issues during Miss

Clark's visit, as well as ways in which to build on our already strong

economic and other ties. I warmly welcome these annual informal meetings

between the Australian and New Zealand Prime Ministers.
